intro: Jacquemontia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan Jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other vine-like plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Jacquemontia guianensis is often found growing in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
